content:
Diagnosis
	1. Metastatic hybrid acinar-neuroendocrine carcinoma of prostate
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	None

	Systemic therapy
	1. Docetaxel/ADT Jan-Mar 2024 - discontinued due to progression
	2. Carboplatin/Etoposide Mar-Apr 2024 - discontinued due to clinical deterioration

	Radiotherapy
	20Gy in 5# to T8-T10 metastases Feb 2024
	20Gy in 5# to right frontal brain metastasis Apr 2024

	Clinical studies
	Not eligible

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with clinical deterioration

	Current issues
	1. Worsening liver function
	2. Increasing right-sided weakness
	3. Deteriorating mobility

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today with deteriorating clinical status. Performance status has declined to ECOG 3. New onset right-sided weakness and unsteady gait following recent brain metastasis. Liver function shows grade 2 transaminitis with bilirubin now 45. PSA rising from 456 to 890. Recent MRI brain shows enlarging right frontal lesion despite radiotherapy, with surrounding edema. CT shows progressive liver metastases with new ascites.

	Further investigations
	None indicated at present stage

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone increased to 8mg bd
	Lactose 3 sachets daily commenced

	Follow up
	Urgent palliative care review arranged
	Acute oncology team informed
	Next oncology review in 1 week

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor LFTs weekly
	Please titrate analgesia as needed
	Please arrange district nurse support

cancer_timeline.value: Discontinued Docetaxel/ADT due to disease progression
20Gy in 5 fractions to right frontal brain metastasis
Discontinued Carboplatin/Etoposide due to clinical deterioration
MRI shows enlarging right frontal lesion with surrounding edema despite radiotherapy
CT shows progressive liver metastases with new ascites

status_updates.value: Metastatic prostate cancer with rapid progression through two lines of therapy. Significant clinical deterioration with neurological symptoms and liver dysfunction
Progressive disease with enlarging brain metastasis despite radiotherapy and new liver progression
Deterioration to ECOG PS 3 with new neurological symptoms
Dexamethasone increased to 8mg twice daily, commenced on lactulose
Urgent palliative care review arranged, oncology review in 1 week
